question: With which of the following Union Cabinet of India signed a Bilateral Investment Treaty?
explanation: The Union Cabinet has given its approval for signing and ratification of the Bilateral Investment Treaty (BIT) between the India and Belarus on Investments. The Treaty is supposed toincrease investment flows between the two countries. It is expected to improve the confidence of the investors resulting in an increase in FDI and Overseas Director Investment (ODI) opportunities and this will have a positive impact on employment generation.
